discoveredAssets: localhost (http://localhost:80) - Markdown to HTML Converter - Werkzeug/3.1.3 Python Flask - Port 80 HTTP
/ - Root endpoint - Form-based markdown conversion interface
/convert - POST endpoint - Markdown conversion form submission endpoint
/admin - Admin Interface - Unauthenticated admin panel providing access to admin functions
/admin/flag - Flag Display - Sensitive endpoint exposing test flag without authentication
/static/style.css - Static CSS asset - Web application stylesheet

targets.objective: Test for input validation vulnerabilities including markdown injection, XXE (if XML processing supported), command injection in markdown processor, SSRF via url parameter, and other code execution attacks
targets.rationale: Critical endpoint that accepts user input (markdown_text and url parameters) for processing. Multiple input fields suggest multiple attack vectors. SSRF via url parameter is particularly concerning.

targets.objective: Test for authentication bypass, authorization flaws (unauthenticated access), privilege escalation, and related admin panel vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: Admin interface is publicly accessible without any authentication or authorization checks. This is a critical security issue indicating potential unauthorized access to administrative functions.

targets.objective: Test for information disclosure, sensitive data exposure, and verify the severity of unauthenticated access to sensitive endpoints
targets.rationale: Endpoint exposes sensitive flag information without authentication. Indicates information disclosure vulnerability. Requires verification of data sensitivity and impact assessment.

targets.objective: Test for XSS, CSRF, input validation bypass, and other web application vulnerabilities in the main conversion form
targets.rationale: Public-facing endpoint with form submission functionality. Potential for stored/reflected XSS if markdown output is not properly sanitized, CSRF attacks on form submission, and input validation bypass.

targets.objective: Comprehensive security assessment including: vulnerability scanning, authentication/authorization testing, input validation, output encoding, business logic flaws, data exposure risks, and technology-specific vulnerabilities (Python/Flask/Werkzeug)
targets.rationale: Full application assessment required to identify all vulnerability classes and ensure comprehensive security testing coverage.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Unauthenticated admin interface accessible at /admin - No authentication required to access admin panel and sensitive functions
[CRITICAL] Sensitive flag information exposed at /admin/flag without any authentication or authorization checks - Information disclosure vulnerability
[HIGH] Input processing endpoint /convert accepts user-supplied markdown_text and url parameters - Potential for injection attacks (markdown injection, XXE, SSRF)
[HIGH] Application uses Werkzeug/3.1.3 (Python Flask) - Verify all dependencies are up-to-date and secure
[MEDIUM] No robots.txt or sitemap.xml found - Standard discovery files not present
[MEDIUM] No API documentation endpoints (swagger.json, openapi.json) found
[LOW] Static assets served from /static/ directory - CSS file accessible, directory listing not enabled
